definition: flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]
gap/to separate/to thin out (seedlings)/to sow discontent
between/among/within a definite time or space/room/section of a room or lateral space between two pairs of pillars/classifier for rooms

sentences.english: So do the corpses in the streets and the ones waiting for identification in the morgue.
sentences.chinese: 还有那些街上的尸体，那些在太平间等着认领的陈尸。

sentences.english: Not another man, except the police doctor, can enter the dead-room.
sentences.chinese: 除了警署的医生以外，任何男人都不许进太平间。

sentences.english: Can you imagine? What had happened was that I was taken to the morgue.
sentences.chinese: 你能想象得到我在太平间的情况吗？

sentences.english: PHILADELPHIA -- The decomposed body of a young boy had rested seven years in the city morgue.
sentences.chinese: 一具男孩的腐尸7年来存放在市太平间里。

sentences.english: Some men came and removed the corpse to bringit to the morgue.
sentences.chinese: 这时一些男性走了进来，将尸体带到太平间。

sentences.english: Then I went to check the morgue, and his body was gone.
sentences.chinese: 然后我去查看了一下太平间，他的尸体不见了。

sentences.english: What do you mean, from the morgue?
sentences.chinese: 你什么意思，从太平间出来？

sentences.english: At the mortuary that morning, the coffin had already been closed.
sentences.chinese: 那天早上在太平间里，棺材已经被盖上了。

sentences.english: He went down to the basement corridor and followed the arrows to the morgue.
sentences.chinese: 他来到地下室走廊，顺着箭头指示到了太平间。

sentences.english: In thought of mother lying in mortuary alone, my heart was as painful as wrung by knife.
sentences.chinese: 想到母亲一个人躺在太平间里，我心如刀绞。

sentences.english: “I’m from the morgue, ” the father said.

definition: to keep the body of the deceased (until burial or cremation)
